FWT.content: “I” am working around a dehiscence, division (more than 1, 2, 3, beyond all arithmetic, calculability)
FWT.linkedContent: “I” am working around a dehiscence, division (more than 1, 2, 3, beyond all arithmetic, calculability)

FWT.content: via Freud, divided, differentiated “subject,” not reduced to egological intentionality, experiences against inexhaustible/invincible background of heteronomy
FWT.linkedContent: via Freud, divided, differentiated “subject,” not reduced to egological intentionality, experiences against inexhaustible/invincible background of heteronomy

DST.content: désistance (2 typical experiences) is ineluctable: 1) il faut que cela arrive: in this case, the “I,” the free subject, anticipates/precedes, is constituted w/out or before, the ineluctable event that happens to me 2) constitutive desistance of subject: something began before me, I am late, a subject marked in advance by a pre-impression, imprint—deconstitution (“I” am not the supporting basis of this imprint): still, ineluctable not genetic programs or historical determination—those would be supplemental, late determinations of ineluctable
DST.linkedContent: désistance (2 typical experiences) is ineluctable: 1) il faut que cela arrive: in this case, the “I,” the free subject, anticipates/precedes, is constituted w/out or before, the ineluctable event that happens to me 2) constitutive desistance of subject: something began before me, I am late, a subject marked in advance by a pre-impression, imprint—deconstitution (“I” am not the supporting basis of this imprint): still, ineluctable not genetic programs or historical determination—those would be supplemental, late determinations of ineluctable

DST.content: Lacoue-Labarthe: subject in mirror is first of all subject in désistance, figure is never one, destabilizing division of figural (this muddles Lacan’s distinction btwn symbolic/imaginary)
DST.linkedContent: Lacoue-Labarthe: subject in mirror is first of all subject in désistance, figure is never one, destabilizing division of figural (this muddles Lacan’s distinction btwn symbolic/imaginary)

DST.content: Lacoue-Labarthe: désistance as a desertion [Derrida quotes a passage w/out usage of désistance] that is prior to any ‘self-possession’ (not mode of dispossession), (de)constitution of subject, can one think of loss re: what one never had?
DST.linkedContent: Lacoue-Labarthe: désistance as a desertion [Derrida quotes a passage w/out usage of désistance] that is prior to any ‘self-possession’ (not mode of dispossession), (de)constitution of subject, can one think of loss re: what one never had?

DST.content: subject—nothing other than formation of movement of désistance
DST.linkedContent: subject—nothing other than formation of movement of désistance

DST.content: delay as inevitable, delay re: one’s “own” birth, experience of “abortion” > a subject that cannot identify itself because ineluctably delayed [Lacan’s human born prematurely]
DST.linkedContent: delay as inevitable, delay re: one’s “own” birth, experience of “abortion” > a subject that cannot identify itself because ineluctably delayed [Lacan’s human born prematurely]

DST.content: condition of possibility of identification is its impossibility (both ineluctable) > subject identifies itself because it can never be identified
DST.linkedContent: condition of possibility of identification is its impossibility (both ineluctable) > subject identifies itself because it can never be identified

DST.content: does Lacoue-Labarthe define a subject from which Heidegger protects himself (and seeks relief [assistance])?
DST.linkedContent: does Lacoue-Labarthe define a subject from which Heidegger protects himself (and seeks relief [assistance])?

DST.content: Lacoue-Labarthe: traversed from the beginning by discourse of others, “subject” does not incur a simple Spaltung (splitting) > the latter, w/ its oppositional logic (absence/position), creates obsession w/ appropriation dominating analysis of mimesis, & also its economic, political bearing
DST.linkedContent: Lacoue-Labarthe: traversed from the beginning by discourse of others, “subject” does not incur a simple Spaltung (splitting) > the latter, w/ its oppositional logic (absence/position), creates obsession w/ appropriation dominating analysis of mimesis, & also its economic, political bearing

DST.content: we are constituted by this rhythm, (de-)constituted by marks of this “caesuraed” stamp, rhythmotypy as divided idiom in us of désistance > no subject w/out signature of this rhythm
DST.linkedContent: we are constituted by this rhythm, (de-)constituted by marks of this “caesuraed” stamp, rhythmotypy as divided idiom in us of désistance > no subject w/out signature of this rhythm

DST.content: Lacoue-Labarthe: [subject] ‘desists’ because must confront at least 2 figures (or one figure that is at least double) > destabilizing Lacan’s imaginary/symbolic
DST.linkedContent: Lacoue-Labarthe: [subject] ‘desists’ because must confront at least 2 figures (or one figure that is at least double) > destabilizing Lacan’s imaginary/symbolic

DST.content: the “loss (perte) of the subject” in Lacan calls for a suturing that obliterates désistance
DST.linkedContent: the “loss (perte) of the subject” in Lacan calls for a suturing that obliterates désistance

HLP.content: classical lying: liar knows the truth, knows he is lying, the self excludes the self-lie (the other is other enough, an enemy to be deceived in his belief)
HLP.linkedContent: classical lying: liar knows the truth, knows he is lying, the self excludes the self-lie (the other is other enough, an enemy to be deceived in his belief)

HLP.content: unless we think the other w/in oneself, an ipseity more originary than ego, a divisible ipseity, oneself as enemy
HLP.linkedContent: unless we think the other w/in oneself, an ipseity more originary than ego, a divisible ipseity, oneself as enemy

D.content: what does it mean to stand upright (se dresser) if inconsistent, divided?
D.linkedContent: what does it mean to stand upright (se dresser) if inconsistent, divided?

OG.content: image is death, it cannot represent & add representer to represented, thus presence of re-presented folded back on itself in the world, presence announces its dispossession w/in its own representer/death > subject: merely this movement of expropriation
OG.linkedContent: image is death, it cannot represent & add representer to represented, thus presence of re-presented folded back on itself in the world, presence announces its dispossession w/in its own representer/death > subject: merely this movement of expropriation

ATAP.content: Nietzsche: my beloved voice deludes my solitude, obliges me to speak as if I were 2
ATAP.linkedContent: Nietzsche: my beloved voice deludes my solitude, obliges me to speak as if I were 2

CIR.content: universal fantasy/desire of divided subject (to understand oneself): Envy & Gratitude
CIR.linkedContent: universal fantasy/desire of divided subject (to understand oneself): Envy & Gratitude

CIR.content: the satyr galatea that I am, half-mourning satyr > the splitting of the ego, in me, is no transcendental claptrap
CIR.linkedContent: the satyr galatea that I am, half-mourning satyr > the splitting of the ego, in me, is no transcendental claptrap

FV.content: indestructibility of letter functions as pact binding 2 “singularities,” excludes all double simulacra: [in Lacan] subject is very divided, but phallus is not to be cut > at origin/end, there’s a word that doesn’t trick: the truth of the lure [p. 466n indivisibility in repetition compulsion]
FV.linkedContent: indestructibility of letter functions as pact binding 2 “singularities,” excludes all double simulacra: [in Lacan] subject is very divided, but phallus is not to be cut > at origin/end, there’s a word that doesn’t trick: the truth of the lure [p. 466n indivisibility in repetition compulsion]

FV.content: Lacan’s “True Speech”: “subject is founded in this act as being the other”
FV.linkedContent: Lacan’s “True Speech”: “subject is founded in this act as being the other”

FV.content: Lacan reconstitutes Cartesian certainty, capturing in this chain (Descartes–Hegel–Husserl) Heideggerian motions which are allergic to it—rigorously speaking
FV.linkedContent: Lacan reconstitutes Cartesian certainty, capturing in this chain (Descartes–Hegel–Husserl) Heideggerian motions which are allergic to it—rigorously speaking

FV.content: for Lacan, ideal process of analysis: “realization” of full speech as assumption of desire (of castration)
FV.linkedContent: for Lacan, ideal process of analysis: “realization” of full speech as assumption of desire (of castration)
